tasks.title: Show tool input parameters in streaming output
tasks.description: When Claude uses tools like Read, Write, Edit, Bash, Grep, Glob, the user currently only sees the tool name. They should also see key parameters like file paths, commands, and patterns to understand what's happening.
acceptance: Read/Write/Edit tools show the file_path parameter
Bash tool shows the description or truncated command
Grep tool shows the pattern and path
Run ralph and confirm tool inputs are visible

tasks.title: Show abbreviated tool results
tasks.description: After tool execution, users should see a brief summary of results so they know what happened without seeing full output. This helps understand progress without overwhelming the terminal.
acceptance: Read results show line count (e.g., '124 lines')
Grep results show match count (e.g., '13 files')
Bash results show first few lines of stdout
Run ralph and confirm result summaries appear

tasks.title: Truncate long text blocks between tool calls
tasks.description: Claude often outputs long explanations of what it's doing or listing many changes. These big text blocks are hard to scan. Truncating to ~10 lines with an indicator makes output more digestible.
acceptance: Text output is limited to ~10 lines between tool calls
Line counter resets when a new tool call starts
Run ralph and confirm long text blocks are truncated

tasks.title: Verify streaming improvements end-to-end
tasks.description: Run ralph on a real feature to verify the streaming improvements work as expected. The output should be more scannable with tool inputs/results visible and long text blocks truncated.
acceptance: Tool calls show file paths and commands
